Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 04:34PM - edited Jun 12, 2009 04:35PM by MattsMom Thanks!  My lymphedema is in my left arm, so hopefully that will be helpful.  I'm thinking about a small Honda Rebel to start off with (is that an upright bike?), then will progress to a bigger bike if it's working out.  I'd love to do the off road too, so I'm not sure which way to go.  Geysermom, I don't have a lymphedema PT at the moment, so yes, I would appreciate your PT's input, thanks!
Posts.Title: Motorcycles MattsMom t9jorda

Posts.Content: MattsMom wrote: I've had mild lymphedema for 7 years now.  I had 17 nodes removed, and 1 was malignant.  It's been managed well, only flaring up with sunburn, insect bite, heavy lifting, ect.  We're thinking about learning to ride motorcycles, and I'm wondering if anyone has experence in riding with lymphedema?  Does it aggravate the condition?
